title: Incredible experience
text: Had a fabulous time at this elephant safari. Washing, feeding and swimming with the elephants and so much more! Lovely staff and beautiful surroundings. A must do for animal lovers. Highly recommended!

title: Love the elephants!!
text: Had a great day at the park. Wonderful to experience the elephants at play. The ride was the highlight but the park was so busy that by the tine our turn came to ride the elephants we missed the show. Our transport came early so were had to leave. The drive up to Taro was lovely taking us through villages. We were there during Gallengan which is a Hindu celebration. The villages were decorated and there was activity everywhere. The Elephant Safari was a great experience and highly recommended but give yourself time to really appreciate it.

title: Not what I thought it would be...
text: Had a great day with the family. Recommend going early and taking the bath the elephant option (wear bathers and take a change of clothes), feed the elephants, have breakfast at the lodge and then go on an elephant ride. Just the most amazing experience and we were there for at least until just after lunch. Took 4 boys aged 14, 13, 12 and 11 and they thought it was the best day ever!

date-review: Robert B wrote a review Sep 2016
title: Memorable stay with the elephants
text: Had a wonderful 3 days stay at this wonderful resort. Chauffeured to dinner by elephant with their trainer/ mahout who clearly loves their elephant & cares for them. We fed,washed & bathed with them truly memorable experience we will never forget. The owner truly cares about the elephants and his guests we even saw him having breakfast in the same place as ourselves & open to chatting with guests. Lovely dining facilities and wide choice at breakfast on top of the wonderful lodges within superb surroundings and able to enjoy a free shuttle to Ubud & back üòä

title: Unique Exotic Lodging
text: Had an amazing experience at Masons, was a bit skeptic after reading some of the views but was pleasantly surprised. Staff were incredibly friendly and welcoming we received a free upgrade and the room was stunning and very clean. The elephant park itself was very well maintained and the elephants looked very well cared for and loved. Would highly recommend this place to anyone visiting Bali thanks Masons ‚ò∫Ô∏è

title: Hotel is normal, but it's the elephant interaction time that's the seller
text: Had an amazing time at the Elephant Safari Park and Lodge. Stayed one night, got picked up by an elephant for dinner, lovely experience. Food was great, eating under the stars with the elephants in the distance. The whole park was beautifully done, and the elephants seemed really happy and their trainers seemed to really care for them. You could have unlimited amount of time just feeding them and hanging out with them. We did the bathing in the morning, shame the elephant pool was being emptied and cleaned as it would have been fun to swim with them, but we understood it has to be cleaned. The afternoon we arrived we watched the younger elephants playing in the pool, it was great to see them enjoying themselves. The babies were great fun. We were a little put off by the; ‚Ä¶

date-review: Annie S wrote a review Nov 2018
title: Didn‚Äôt stay but had a great time on elephant ride!
text: Had the best experiences ever at this place the animals are so beautiful, loved it all including their breakfast. Got to meet the owners and an Australian worker there who filled us in on the background of the place and animals. It‚Äôs a must see place in Bali. üòä

Had the most incredible experience that will remain with me for the rest of my days with the gentle Sumatran giants at Mason Elephant Park in Ubud. We were thoroughly impressed with the affable owner and founder of the park, Nigel Mason. He has established a first class sanctuary for the last few remaining Sumatran elephants in Indonesia. They are exceptionally well cared for, loved and treated as family by their Mahouts (elephant carer). The park is pristine, their diet is controlled as is their exercise regime and they have a successfully and naturally bred five baby elephants thus far. We were lucky enough to meet a the latest addition to the family - Arjun - who was only one day old. I would highly recommend this place for all animal lovers. Wow, wow, wow.

Had the most wonderful time getting to know the elephants at this safari park. We went late in the day, got almost the whole place to ourselves and had lovely one:one time with the elephants, the highlight was cuddling the baby elephants who were inquisitive and gentle at the same time. We didn't stay there but the accommodation looked pretty amazing. A wonderful afternoon destination for families and 'big kids' alike!

title: Thank you for our experience with the elephants
text: Have just returned from the Elephant Safari Park. We had a deal to stay for 3 nights including breakfast, evening meal and spending time with the elephants. I think when we booked we were user the impression that the park was in Ubud. It's not. It's at least 30 minutes away and there is nothing near the park. Once there it's pretty isolated. The staff were friendly and helpful. Food wasn't bad and prices reasonable considering we were stuck. Pool not very inviting. Spa offered limited services. I feel that 1 night would have been enough. And yes the elephants are chained up but they appear to be well looked after and the park is clean and tidy

Having a daily elephant safari ride plus a ride to dinner was very cool. You can get up close to the babies and play with the adults as well as washing the adults in the morning. There are so many photo-ops within the park on a daily basis! The bathroom, especially the shower, will be the model if we ever have a house built. The bed was very comfortable and the air-conditioner was perfectly refreshing. The food in the restaurant was great and moderately priced. There are set dinner special menus nightly as well as a regular menu. I think we got the specials every night. Breakfast was fantastic. Along with the regular menu selections, you get a big plate of fruit, some juice, and the best coffee I've ever had. There is also a very nice turn down service with an accompanying; ‚Ä¶

title: Expensive and treated like second class.
text: Highly recommended, the day we went it was raining very heavily but the elephants seemed to love it and were playing in the water. We just paid for entry which was only US$19 adult, elephant ride and lunch were extras. The museum was great with wooly mammoth skeleton and other very interesting artefacts.

title: Horrific....we left after 2 hours as I was so distraught at what we witnessed - DO NOT FUND PLACES LIKE THIS
text: Honestly, I had no big expectations about this place but fortunately I found very special. It is expensive but unique. We were riding with Jajang (trainer) and Efa (elephant), during the ride we were told about the special relationship between the trainer and the elephant because they are like family. The elephants are very nice with the people and off course, all the place is really beautiful. Jajang was very polite and attentive with us. In addition, there is a small and interesting museum at the entrance related to elephants. I with my family enjoyed but as a recommendation, check your pocket before deciding to go since it is not cheap.

date-review: John P wrote a review May 2019
title: Hotel and restaurant was very poor
text: Hotel is a little out of the way, which is great. Wonderful layout. We had a park view room. Spacious, clean with great amenities. Was perfect to wake up to elephants staring back at us from the balcony. I read the reviews about the elephants and how this wasn't a sanctuary. And I'm not an elephant whisperer. That being said, I did talk to the elephant guy there. The elephants are chained when on their resting pads. These pads were made for them and they each have their own. It provides a safe space to be able to eat and rest without fear of being attacked or have their food taken from them. These elephants are from Sumatra and are not from the same herd (so they will attack each other and the boys will go after the girls). They've had 3 baby elephants born there; ‚Ä¶

Hotel was very normal with walls so thin you could hear and make out what other people were saying and watching on TV. Breakfast was decent and the pool almost non existant considering the amazing pools in most Balinese hotels. However, staying at the hotel gets you amazing benefits. You get one elephant ride per day, access to the park, which means the show, feeding and interacton with the elephants. Early in the morning you can help wash the elephants. Scrubbing them before they swim. And then you can ride bareback on them as they swim in the water and dunk you a couple times. Very fun. You also get picked up at dinner time by an elephant chaffuer to take you to dinner. So, the hotels not great, but your not going for that anyway....right?

title: Magic experience
text: How magic to be able to spend time in a top quality lodge with such beautiful creatures. We had limited time in the lodge and the staff went out of their way to ensure we had the best experience possible.

title: Best time in Bali
text: hughe clean rooms. Book a package (find the early bird) and the stay includes the riding, cuddling, diner, breakfast, washing and swimming with the elephants. Very well organized, good care for guest and elephant. Come early and check out late, we stayed 1 night and the 24 hours we were in the park were way to short.

I am a massive animal lover who is very sceptical about the ethical treatment of animals so after researching this place thoroughly, both myself and my husband decided to go, keeping the thought in the back of our mind that of we noticed any animal cruelty or animals in distress we would immediately leave and get our money back (they off 100% money back guarantee that‚Äôs how confident they are in the treatment of their elephants). Yes while the elephants eat they have a lose chain on their ankle, this is and what was evidential was for their safety as they get a little a bit possessive and charge at each other, after they have finished their lunch they are free to take a swim in a massive pool to wash and cool off, free to approach guest to get more fruit via hand feeding; ‚Ä¶

I am a travel agent and the experience of staying there completely out-weighs doing a day trip. By staying there, there are more inclusions on the property like washing the elephants and swimming with them. I would stay there a million more times (and I am planning on going there again next year). The people who day tripped it out to the lodge got a ride and saw the elephants but it is nothing compared to staying there. Stay in a Park View room as well. Well worth the extra money you spend!

I am so glad a friend at home recommended we book a night at the elephant park lodge rather than just do the day trip! It was so much more of an experience ! We left our villa in canggu to spend the night - arrived at 3 and were shown to our park suite . Having come from our villa we were expecting more of the same - but no, this room is world class standard not just good Bali standard . Feather pillows , king size comfy bed , immaculate marble and glass bathroom with grohe tap ware . But best of all our balcony opened onto the park where the elephants were munching on their dinner just feet away ! It was amazing. An elephant collected us from our villa for dinner and elePhant talent show. The dinner , we opted for the buffet, was ok better than most but nothing amazing. Next; ‚Ä¶

I am, hands down, one of the biggest elephant adorers out there! So getting to see these beautiful creatures was absolutely wonderful :-) Biggest down side was that our Mahout used his "training stick" way too often and way too hard - I don't believe animals need to be physically punished in order for them to obey. We also hated how the elephants were chained with little food and no shade during the day when they weren't being used for rides etc. they didn't even have mud or dirt for a dirt bath Loved getting to hand feed these greedy guts, the staff helped get the elephants into great positions for photos and they had a few tricks up their sleeves! We also loved getting to see the elephants frolic and play in the water with one another while we ate lunch - their happy; ‚Ä¶

I believed that people often got confused with reality and follows trends, in our opinion animals at this place are treated reasonable not perfect but reasonable, it is true the elephants they are hit over the head with a little hammer to steer left or right, tourist must understand they do not have electronics, somehow the handler must drive this beautiful animals, in our case the elephant run into a tree when a fruit just drop nearly tip us all, overall experience good after the ride elephants are taking into a pool where you can take pictures and feed them with sugar cane pictures are taken,,,a buffet lunch is provided if you pay for it, of course first.... all good

title: Worth it
text: I booked a rice paddy view room because I imagined a peaceful, calm space. How far from the truth this proved to be. While the room balcony does have a view of rice paddies it also backs onto the resort kitchen, with zero sound insulation. There are also at least two pumps activating every minute throughout the day from 7am until 8.30pm, along with some kind of alarm beeping, cutlery and metal platters clattering until at least 10.30pm. I was so relieved I only booked one night. The resort is much smaller than I imagined with most of the "park view" rooms looking over empty elephant resting pads during the day, chained elephants at dusk and excrement strewn pads in the morning. It certainly wasn't the romantic idyll I imagined. You can "swim with the elephants" which involves; ‚Ä¶

I booked half day tour package online for my wifeÔºåmyself and my 5 years old daughter. which include transport from hotel in Ubud. 30 mins elephant safari ride. elephant talent show and lunch. Driver picked up us around 8:10am. and we arrived before 9am. we finished safari ride before 1st talent show which is on 10:15. We have plenty time walk around in park before lunch. My kid had great fun with elephants. Will try accommodation in lodge and safari under star next time.

date-review: M I wrote a review Sep 2018
title: Everything it SHOULDN'T be...no love for elephants at all
text: I booked to stay at the Elephant Safari Park Lodge despite reading the mixed reviews and went with a positive mind. I really wanted it to be a wonderful experience where they treated the elephants well. However, when I turned up I realised this was NOT the case . All the elephants are chained to the ground by a 2 foot chain and can barely move . The only time they appear to get "walked" is when tourists get their rides. The mahouts use bull hooks on all the elephants to make them bend down, walk a certain way and do what is needed to put on a good show for tourists . They hide this well , but once you notice it you can't unsee it . They are CONSTANTLY stabbing the sharp metal bull hook into the elephants heads and behind ears. The elephant acts are repetitive and it feels; ‚Ä¶

I came here because one of my greatest loves on this earth are Elephants. I did not contribute to any rides, all I wanted to do was hug and feed these beautiful creatures. They were roaming free in the grounds and the up close personal experience was mind blowing! If you want to see the elephants this is definitely the place to be BUT only pay for a healthy fruit and veggie bowl to feed them with, do not buy any rides, its not worth exploiting these babies or contributing to the abuse.

title: Magical Elephant Experience
text: I came here for an elephant ride on the 31st of August 2015, but not to stay in their lodge. Had tried the other safari park in Bali already,, and really speechless with this, that the way they treat the elephant,, the show,, the elephant ride, etc are really amazing. They are really the best and the expert for elephant safari park. the food after the elephant ride at their restaurant also very good, and really recommended. The only things that the price is very expensive, especially for the local people.

I can‚Äôt even begin to put into words how absolutely awesome this place is!! We booked the jumbo wash with lunch and had a beyond amazing time!!!! it was so wonderful getting up close with the elephants and seeing them in their close to natural habitat. There trainers were there taking photos on my phone for me and interacting with the elephants. The lunch buffet was nice, the selection was minimal but sufficient. The pasta salad could have more flavour as it was quite bland but the banana cake was ü§§ü§§ü§§!! The park has a new baby elephant and she is the cutest little thing ever!! If you‚Äôre worried about ‚Äúwasting money‚Äù, ‚Äúwhether it‚Äôs worth it‚Äù etc. It is 110% worth it!!!! They also offer return and pick up services.

I can't actually explain how incredible this experience is. Everything from the hospitality of the staff to the majestic and loving nature of the elephants is truly spectacular. This experience is incomparable to anything based in the UK and for roughly the same price. This hands on experience is extremely well put together and far surpassed any expectations I had which all came together through a truly personal experience with some of the most gentle giants in the world!

I can't even begin to describe how amazing the Elephant Safari Park and Lodge is. I visited Bali for two weeks, and this was the highlight of my trip. The elephants are really beautiful animals and I had a lot of fun feeding the baby elephants, going on an elephant ride. When we arrived, we watched an elephant show where they were doing all sorts of tricks such as kicking soccer balls into nets. We then had dinner there and it was an amazing buffet - everything was so delicious. Definitely felt full after that!!! Our room were beautiful - even the little touches such as elephant shaped towels in the bathroom. The next morning, we fed baby elephants. They're adorable and so fun to watch. We went for breakfast which, given the dinner last night, I expected nothing short of; ‚Ä¶

I can't recommend this place enough for a special and unique weekend retreat. The food was delicious. The staff were lovely and accommodating. The grounds are very well maintained (which is quite a feat since they're home to the world's largest herd of rescued Sumatran elephants). The best part was that the animals seemed happy and well taken care of.

I can't see how anyone with an inch of love or compassion for these wonderful creatures would enjoy this circus. We left two hours after checking in....too distraught at what we saw, me in tears at the 'talent show' which we could only endure for 3 minutes... Any way....lets start from the beginning... We paid ¬£225 for 2 nights in an 'Elephant Sanctuary' ...to be amongst our favourite animals roaming around freely and a chance for us to get up close to them...instead here is what we witness and details of why places like this should not be funded.... 1. All elephants, unless they are being forced to take photos or paraded in the 'talent show', are CHAINED TO THE GROUND. The image on the website shows a lady being massaged by a pool with elephants dotted in the background with; ‚Ä¶

I communicated with the lodge prior to arrival regarding transportation provided to the lodge, I was told since I booked with expedia, "i was provided such a service, and the cost would be $55 per person." Upon arrival, I was greeted with "you booked with expedia correct." The front desk was less than kind during several interactions-this is the first impression and the last impression-and it is not a good one. Once you are inside the park, the experience is incredible. If it were not for the experience, you would be very dissatisfied and the lodge could not stand on its own merit. We booked through expedia because we saved about three hundred a night, and I wanted to provide my daughter the experience. It is unfortunate they are not paying attention to those who can; ‚Ä¶

I could not agree more with some of the previous reviews that state that this is not a sanctuary but rather a circus. The place promotes to be a safe haven for the elephants & to be animal centred. I was heartbroken to see the animal handlers using the bull hooks to control the animals and were poking them in the sensitive spot between the eyes. The elephants were forced to pose for photos, to perform tricks such as only standing on 3 legs & spraying the audience with water on que & of course, performing rides for tourists. At the end of the day, they were all separated & chained in separate places. It was expensive to go, & I felt completely ripped off & deceived about the honesty of this place. 8 months later, I am still thinking about those poor animals with a heavy heart.

I could watch the elephants at breakfast, lunch and dinner and so enjoyed sharing their days from bathing, and swiming to watching them chomp through hundreds of kilograms of food. I had a paddy view room and besides it being a beautiful peaceful vista I also enjoyed watching the ladies as it was rice harvesting time. The room was spacious and very nice with 30 foot ceilings. So enjoyed my stay.

I did the Safari Under The Stars tour in early March. It was absolutely beautiful here. The Elephants are treated so kindly. We got to feed them, we watched an entertaining performance, then got a ride through the jungle at night time. Our tour also included a DELICIOUS 5 course dinner. The food was amazing. The service was great. I also had a friend cancel that morning on a ticket I had already paid for. I couldn't get a refund but they were happy to let me use the ticket cost as credit in the park for souvenirs, drinks and it also paid for my photo on the Elephant. So i was happy with that. Would love to stay a couple nights here in the future :)

title: Rice Paddy View Room 27
text: I didn‚Äôt research this place enough before booking. It became instantly unattractive on the first elephant ‚Äúsafari‚Äù when they explained the elephants are chained by one foot except when ‚Äúperforming‚Äù and have a radius of about 6 feet of movement and they pointed to a strong male who was separated as he was angry at the moment as wanted to mate. The pictures on web site portray a much more free and natural Environment but it‚Äôs far from that. They are performing animals trained to take you on their back or stand still while you spray water on them. The rooms are ok but again the views and set up are a step down on the website impression and the breakfast at ¬£400 per night rooms isn‚Äôt good enough. Overall I would have left early if I hadn‚Äôt prepaid and only had one full day; ‚Ä¶

date-review: Basel B wrote a review Jun 2019
title: Very sad place for the elephants
text: I didn‚Äôt want to ride the elephants I was quite happy feeding them and hosing them down. Very organised even if it did seem like a conveyor belt! The elephants did look well kept. There is a souvenir shop & restaurant on site

title: Once in a lifetime
text: I fell in love with the elephants. Although i was incredibly happy to see the elephants it was very painful to see elephants tied up with chains and their keepers with a hammer type tool to keep the elephants in order. Before i got there i thought i was going to see elephants enjoying their freedom. I really broke my heart to see them like this.

I felt attracted to the pictures of the elephant park I saw before we went there: I imagined to see elephants, who could freely move in a certain territory. I imagined to meet elephants, who could decide themselves when they wanted to meet another elephant. The reality I experienced was totally different: Each elephant has a separate place about 40 meters away from the next elephant. As soon as an elephant is not needed for the tourist attraction, it gets fixed with a very short chain on its separate place. Even the baby elephants mother is fixed with a very short chain. I watched some elephants behaviour and tuned into them. What I felt was resignation, depression and sadness. I would never visit this park or another park where all elephants are fixed on short chains ever; ‚Ä¶

I found the elephant Park to be very informative for visitors and very beneficial to the elephants that live there. Some people seem overly upset by the fact that the elephants are chained while eating. The reason the elephants are chained is so that they do not fight with each other over food. One must remember that these were captive elephants that were rescued and brought to this facility to ensure their safety and well-being. As such the park officials and handlers make every effort to ensure the safety and well-being of each elephant at the facility. The elephants are very well taken care of, as shown by their willing interaction with their handlers and the visitors that come to the park. In Sumatra where these elephants are native to has cine dramatic decline in their; ‚Ä¶

I gave this to my daughter and her friend as a gift and they worked with me by messenger to arrange the whole bathing and breakfast with the elephants. They could not have been nicer. They picked them up at their hotel and they got to spend time cleaning the elephants and then going into the water with them. It was extremely exciting. They were good about taking pictures. They also went on an elephant ride around the park nd had a lovely breakfast. Definitely worth it!

date-review: Nicole L wrote a review May 2012
title: One of the highlights of our trip
text: I had a fantastic time at the Elephant Safari Park and Lodge, stayed two nights and didn't want to leave. The place is amazing, the elephants are obviously very happy - we spent a lot of time just watching them playing in the pool. They are very well cared for by their mahouts who are obviously devoted to them. The show and the rides are not only fun for the tourists, but are obviously exercise for the elephants, which is needed for them to remain in such good condition. Although the elephants were the main attraction, the beautifully landscaped gardens and ponds were delightful. The restaurant and meals were first class, and our room was very comfortable with a great view of the paddy fields. Loved the baby elephants, and hope to get back next year to see the new baby due; ‚Ä¶

title: Majic experience and a wonderful adventure
text: I had a great time at the Elephant Safari Park and Lodge. I'm really glad we stayed at the Lodge as it enabled me to get chauffered to dinner on an elephant, bath an elephant and swim with an elephant. I would definitely recommend this hotel. I had a lovely relaxing time swimming in the pool while watching the elephants. Thank you

title: Best place I have ever visited!!!!
text: I had an overnight stay which is amazing as you certainly get to have an amazing elephant fix. I did not know what to expect as some of the reviews were not so great but I saw elephants that were treated well with no sharp objects used on them like some other countries. I did not ride an elephant was was happy to feed and experience washing them and that up close contact! Beautiful stay!

title: Highlight of our holiday so far.
text: I had done some research and read other reviews before selecting the Elephant experience I wanted. Although a two hour drive from Benoa/Nusa Dua it was so worth it! The Elephant Safari Park was booked through Bali Adventure Tours and I've had an awesome time. The takers are linked with only one elephant and mine had been with the elephant for 18 years and they had come from Sumatra together, there is clearly a bond. The animals are cared for and treated well and the park surroundings are peaceful and well maintained. My 30 min walk was through the park and in jungle like setting, nothing rushed and I was able to sit on the elephant for a while not just in the seat......amazing feeling. Buffet lunch was provided too with a variety of eastern and western foods, very tasty and nice; ‚Ä¶

I had looked forward to seeing the elephants in a happy safe place from the moment I got off the plane in Bali. Seriously happy and excited to witness elephants that have been ‚Äòrescued‚Äô now in a safe haven.. My boyfriend and I bought our tickets to wash and bathe the elephants at something like ¬£120 for the two of us. As we entered it was to my surprise it was almost like a circus, where the elephants were performing tricks, ridding, posing for photos... I couldn‚Äôt hold back my tears as anyone who is educated on the intelligent mammal should know it‚Äôs not in there nature to do this and it means they have been separated from their mother and tortured and trained into a ‚Äòsubmissive mode‚Äô... the way people/ tourists were climbing on the elephants, laughing as the instructors; ‚Ä¶

date-review: Amy L wrote a review Jun 2016
title: Out of this world
text: I had my wedding in elephant safari park and lounge. To have an elephant wedding was my dream and elephant safari park and lounge had made my dream come true. I was like a princess when we sit on elephant with glamorous gown. All my family had a wonderful experiences there, from 4 years old kind till 65 years old grandpa were loved the shows and activities. All wedding staff were very nice and provide themselves a lot on our wedding and banquet. My wedding venue was extremely beautiful and all the traditional process went very well, the ceremony was super touched. My husband and I appreciated them a lot and hope we will have our anniversary trip there in the future.

title: Elephant bathe and breakfast
text: I had planned to visit this park as my daughter is crazy about animals but after reading some of the negative reviews I was a little nervous. We where picked up early in order to be at the park by 8 o'clock we had a very enjoyable drive to the park although it was raining but as we arrived at the park the sun came out. It is a little upsetting seeing the elephants chained but once you start to interact with them and their keepers you can see they are not harmed by this treatment. Our guide met us upon arrival and took us directly to wash our elephant I cannot explain the feeling you get of this gentle giant standing happily while we scrubbed and wet her. After the washing you make your way down to a pool area with three or four elephants already in the water your guide takes you; ‚Ä¶

i had the opportunity to stay in the hotel for a night and we were treated like royalty. we were given a planned out itinerary of our stay which was very helpful. we got to see many elephant talent shows. that night for dinner we were picked up by an elephant at our front door of our hotel room and brought to dinner where we served a buffy style dinner where the food was truly lovely. the next morning we were informed if we were up we could bathe with the elephants which we did. yet terrifying I've never had so much fun in my life the trainer was lovely and the elephant was so content to be swimming in the water. i will definitely return!

title: Nice elephant conservation
text: I have a passion for elephants so when I saw this place come up when looking at hotels on Bali I was over the moon and booked a two night stay over Christmas as a treat for myself and daughter. We arrived and we treated very politely and shown to a very nice room with lovely bathroom. Room had mini bar and very comfortable beds. We went off to look round park first impressions are that it is a well maintained garden but it's the elephants that we were there for. They are chained up on concrete pads where they are forced to eat and go to toilet in same spot, the images on the website give the impression of a much larger park area. The only exercise these elephants get is when they are carrying people on the walk around. There were a couple of the elephants that did not seem to; ‚Ä¶

I have just returned from the Elephant safari park we had a great time trekking, feeding and playing with the beautiful Elephants who all seem happy enough. I had a few issues, one been the massive Arapaima a 2 meter fish from the Amazon been kept in a pond and I'm being generous when I say pond. The poor thing could hardly turn around. And also like alot of others the elephants that were chained was not very nice to see. I realise they have to be but does it have to be on such a short chain. There was a young elephant that looked to be dancing with discomfort.

I have mixed feelings about this one. As a hotel its lovely and our kids (aged 5 & 7) were very enthousiastic about the elephants. But it is terribly expensive and you don't see any Indonesian people there. Somehow it feels not right to be spending twice the monthly salary of an Indonesian teacher on one night, dinner and elephant rides.... But back to the lodge: we had a very spacious corner room with a nice bathroom. There was a complimentary fruit basket and upon arriving we got a complete shedule for our stay that made sure we would see the show, have a ride and so on. Eveyrthing is perfectly arranged. The park itself is small. In my opinion it's not worth the steep entry price if you're just there for the day. The first afternoon we saw the show, interacted with the; ‚Ä¶

I have not stayed at the Lodge yet but hopefully will soon. We visited the park last year for the first time and I was just blown away by these beautiful creatures and how close you could get to them, We revisited this September and unfortunately chose the day the main pond was being drained for cleaning. This was more than made up for by actually meeting Nigel Mason, (my hero), who was down in the muck helping out. Nigel was very friendly and informative and as we were leaving tooted and waved to us from his little bobcat. I just love this park and cant wait for my next trip.

I have so much to say about the Safari Elephant Lodge in Taro! It was an amazing time! And everything was so well done! The staff was quite welcoming and accomodating, the food was excellent, the room was the perfect size and layout for a family of 4. And best of all the Elephants were amazing! My husband had his doubts driving 2.5 hours into Bali with a 4 year old and 8 year old. But I kept telling him how great it looked on line. Sure enough when we got there he seemed content, but when we went into our room and opened the balacony doors my husband's (and all of us for that matter) jaw dropped! He said "holy smokes, this place is sooo worth the money!" That coming from a very frugle man! Each day was scheduled for us, which was nice knowing what to expect and where; ‚Ä¶

I have to admit we had great fun washing and riding the elephants into a pool. Breakfast was great too and dinner was good but very haute cuisine as in not so much on your plate. So why average? Because being at the park made me realize they give higher priority to making money then to the welfare of the elephants. They are taken good care of by their hamout and get plenty of food on the flipside they have to entertain people 12 hours a day and are chained to a spot when not attended. Our mahout told me the elephant was better of in Sumatra, that he only came to Bali with the elephant for the money. 3million Rph to 300.000 Rph. So although I had a great time I would not visit this lodge anymore, but please decide for yourself.

I have travelled to a lot of places, and this is now one of my favourite. The park itself is absolutely beautiful. The grounds are huge, and so perfectly kept - exotic flowers and little ponds all over the place. We arrived late at night and went to the 24hr bar after our long flight, where we were greeted by friendly staff. The mammoth head bar overlooks the swimming pool and the area where the elephants sleep at night. You could just make out their silhouettes, it was magical. In the morning we went to breakfast at the same bar, while watching the elephants. The breakfast buffet was smaller than some other hotels but there were not too many guests staying and there was still plenty of choice. We then went to wash the elephants, first showering them and then riding them in; ‚Ä¶

I have visited an elephant sanctuary before, and this one is nothing like it. The elephants are not let free to roam and socialize, for most of the time they are kept in place with a chain 1 meter short. When not chained, they are forced to carry tourists on their back. And don't be fooled by what the park advertises, about how good this actually is for the elephants. Their spine gets deformed bu heavy weights, and the training they undergo in order to be so docile is cruel beyond imagination. Do your research, and find out how an actual sanctuary looks like. And please don't take part in this cruel activity...

date-review: Richa V wrote a review Feb 2016
title: Do you love elephants? Still not visited :O
text: I have visited few elephant safari, here I found healthy elephants. Good environment and talented staff to handle elephant. Ride elephant around with nice panorama of rice fields. It is located out skirt of ubud approximately 30 min drive from Ubud center.

title: Forget Swimming With Dolphins, Try swimming with Elephants
text: I highly recommend staying here, even if its just for one night. The surroundings, food, service and the whole experience was all 5 star. The elephants have all been rescued and being able to wash them, swim with them and ride on them was an amazing, once in a lifetime experience. The price of the room includes all interaction with elephants, a delicious breakfast of your choice and a cocktail and nice cool face washer on arrival which was heaven after our long trip from the Gili Islands. Our one night here was the highlight of our holiday. We were upgraded from a paddy view room to a park side room so we could get picked up by an elephant and taken to dinner which was an added bonus.

title: Elephant Experience
text: I highly recommend the elephant bathe & swim!! Such a great experience. Elephants are extremely well cared for. I would definitely go again. So lovely to see the cute little baby and his mumma. See you next time :)

I just recently stayed the weekend with my wife and we were absolutely amazed by the lodge, our room, the services, the great food and of course....about the elephants. We had a great time feeding them and petting them after the elephant ride. The park takes really good care of all the elephants and we were truly sad that we couldn't stay longer. We will certainly be back.

I keep thanking my boyfriend for the surprise he gave me....I'm lucky to be spoiled with these amazing experience on Jan 2016. It never cross my mind to be able to have live interaction with lots of wild elephants. Had fun to remembering those elephants name as well as playing with baby elephants. Yes, it is expensive but worth the price. Stayed at the lodge with lots of many activities and close interaction with elephants. I personally would love to say that I will come back again to this place :) :) :) (Great place, food, staffs and services...you named it!!)

I looked into the Elephant Lodge before staying there and I was still a little nervous; I can handle places that exploit animals. The first thing I noticed that made me question the park's intentions was that the elephants were chained. I soon learned this was for the safety of the elephants, people, and of course to protect the property. Later I noticed how the elephants were only chained when they were resting for short times during the day and night. This is also their personal space where they get fed. The other thing that concerned me was the elephants seeming to be "working" and performing. It wasn't long that I realized these elephants were kept stimulated. They had "jobs" that involved people loving them and caring for them and feeding them. They rotated their jobs so; ‚Ä¶

date-review: Emmy P wrote a review Jun 2018
title: DONT VISIT
text: I love animals and am an activist for animal rights. I reached out to learn more about this sanctuary before traveling to Bali for yoga retreat. Director reached out to me personally and I spoke in length with the manager about their training practices, living conditions of the elephants and care for them. Though in my heart I would love to see all elephants free in the wild, after speaking to director and manger and watching their documentary ‚ÄòOperation Jumbo‚Äô I am so happy that these beautiful animals were rescued from Sumatra.

I loved this place and didn't think the elephants were abused. Their skin is TOUGH so yes they use something that looks like a little hammer to direct them. But it's more like a tap tap tap. Not like hard banging. I wish they didn't have to be chained too but can you imagine if a loose elephant hurt someone? They get to walk free a lot actually. During the bathing, the safaris, the shows. Breakfast and Dinner buffets were excellent. World class. However: There were ants in our room and elephant poo permeated the air. But they clean it up quickly. It's nature. It happens. This place is still paradise in my opinion. Just to see these sweet, gentle, adorable animals. Just amazing and awe inspiring. We did the elephant bathing, the night time safari and saw the show. Stayed here 2; ‚Ä¶

title: A most amazing expereince!!!
text: I may be biased as I have wanted to go to this place since I saw a Getaway show on it 4 or 5 years ago! I wish I had made the effort earlier. Top service from accommodation to spa quality to food to how the elephants are treated. Many people visit the park but don't get to do the best activities that start early in the morning like washing the elephants and riding them bare - I mean, holding ears only! Terrifying but the best experience! So make sure you stay at least overnight- but stay at a room facing the park not the garden for maximum experience. Imagine having the elephants just a metre or two away from your balcony and imagine getting picked up by an elephant taxi at your door! And my they are such sweeeeet creatures. 2 nights was the minimum for me. There are other; ‚Ä¶

I read so many reviews about this place before I came, some negative and some positive! Being a huge animal lover I was very sceptical however I‚Äôm so glad I went! What a special way to end our holiday and honeymoon! We paid extra to stay in the park view room and well worth the money in my opinion. Opening your doors to see those beautiful elephants, waking up to them and going to sleep with the there is such a lovely experience! So where do I start .. we stayed two nights (this is ample by the way) On arrival we were greeted by very friendly reception staff, and received a complimentary drink (Very tasty). They went through all details with us thoroughly, showed us round, took us to our room and brought our luggage up to us. On arrival to the room we had a lovely fruit bowl,; ‚Ä¶

title: Mixed Feelings
text: I read the reviews on tripadvisor and had mixed emotions about going to the elephant safari lodge. Firstly, i was shocked at how expensive it was! Over $100 AUS. Besides riding the elephants there's nothing much else to do. I expected a large area we would be able to walk around and view all the elephants, instead you are confined to a small area to feed and watch the elephants. The elephant ride was nice and a decent distance. The trainer was lovely and very knowledgeable on the elephants. I liked that each elephant had its trainer. Thats were the nice stuff stops. The elephants looked so sad. When they are not being used for rides they are chained to a circle of concrete rocking back and forth and many of the elephants had sores on their legs. I came away from there feeling; ‚Ä¶

I really love elephants, and I had my doubts about this place since the reviews were controversial. The staff were all very friendly and super nice, so I chatted quite a lot with some of them, especially the mahouts, which are the elephants' trainers and caregivers. Each elephant has his/her own mahout, who is responsible for that one elephant. In my opinion, the mahouts really cared about and loved their elephants. I asked about why some of the elephants had to be chained to their own pad, and they explained that it was for their own safety and health, as some may not be friendly towards others, and may demonstrate aggressive or destructive behavior. Maybe I just didn't want to believe that this place was cruel to these animals, but anyhow, I had a good time during my stay.; ‚Ä¶

title: Fabulous for the children
text: I recently visited the Elephant safari park and lodge it was a great time, there is lots to do there is elephant rides, elephant feeding, a show, shops, restaurants etc.. although it is fun riding an elephant and feeding an elephant they always seem to be around and with humans, elephants are social animals and they should have a an hour or 2 to them selves and not chains up on the hottest days they should have a pen house (with shade) so that they can play with other elephants... as a little boy like me it was fun riding on the elephants but it made me nervous when they give them a little tap with an small iron tool to make them go left or right and you can tell that they are starving because they stop to eat leaves and then they give them a kick or a tap to make them go and; ‚Ä¶

I recently went to Bali and visited the Mason elephant Park. I cannot see how anyone would be stupid enough to see this as a refuge as Mason claims, anyone with half a brain and their eyes open must be able to see it is purely a money making elephant factory. First entering I was struck with how similar it is to the opening scenes in Jurassic Park.The elephants 24 of them live in three acres!!! Within this tiny space they are all chained by the ankle, to a roughly 8 foot chain, and shackled 24 hours a day. except when they were escorted to play for the tourists, this show was reminiscent of the 1940's where the elephant wore toutous, painted using their trunks, and played football..I do not know exactly what they did as I was too distraught to watch Absolutely jaw droppingly; ‚Ä¶

I should state first that my kids (6 and 9) loved their overnight stay at the elephant park and I did enjoy rubbing the elephants trunks and faces while feeding them (who wouldn't?). But this is a strange place. It claims to be a "sanctuary" driven by a desire to rescue elephants and breed them. They don't like being categorised as a theme park (although that's the category of tourist award that they display at the check-in). However, the last movement of elephants occurred in 2004 and that traffic is now forbidden by the Indonesian government. There has not been an elephant born here for years. So this is probably a dead-end for these elephants and for this part of the Mason family business interest. Even if elephants were bred here, Mr Mason admits that they would be; ‚Ä¶

title: Gotta try it
text: I spent 3 nights in it and it was my best nights in a whole month !! Rlxing good staff clean nice atmosphere especially when you can see the elephants when you want and delicious food too !! Really glad we stayed here while in Ubud

title: fantastic park, spectacular gardens, warm staff, gentle beasties
text: I spent two nights at the lodge with my wife and 19 years old daughter and we fell in love with this place: the location is idyllic and the staff all very kind and professional. Then the main attractions: the elephants, that we could see, watch, touch and even wash! We really enjoyed our stay, thanks to all the very nice staff members who truly love elephants and helped us learn more about these beautiful, majestic and very intelligent animals. If you have time, do not forget to visit the Spa, that fully deserves the Conde Nast recognition received a couple of years ago.

title: Amazing
text: I stayed at the hotel for two nights from 29 dec to 31 dec for my honeymoon . The hotel upgraded my room as i an a honeymooner and that was so sweet . The room was very clean and the stuff was very helpful i would like to come again next year

date-review: Laura J wrote a review Sep 2012
title: Wow!
text: I stayed for one night & it was fun. I probably wouldn't stay any longer though as we did everything we needed to do. Room was lovely, staff friendly, food at the restaurant was good. I did try the spa with my sister & friend & was a little disappointed with the lack of privacy. We had just a curtain between us which was open during treatment. Once complete the lights were on & we were ushered towards a shower & asked if we would like to all go in to shower together!

title: Loved it! Great with the kids.
text: I stayed for one night at the Elephant Safari Lodge with my husband and other family in an adjoining paddy view room. We chose to stay here because we wanted an experience where you get close to the elephants. And our experience was that this is a place where you can get incredibly close to elephants. You can hand-feed the elephants, experience a safari ride, participate in washing the elephants and 'swim' with the elephants, which was an unforgettable experience involving riding bareback on an elephant while it takes a dip in the bathing lake. All the activities were included in the price of the room and they were fantastic. Personally, I wasn't a big fan of the elephant show which plays 4x daily and which involves elephant performing some minor tricks. Although it only lasts; ‚Ä¶

date-review: Tony Wei wrote a review Jan 2016
title: The place you must go~~~
text: I stayed here with my boyfriend last week, and it was meant to be the highlight of my trip- considering I absolutely love elephants, and had researched a lot into this place, and it had come up with nothing but positive things about the venue, rooms, and treatment of these animals. Apparently these elephants are saved from a terrible life of starvation, and taken to this 'sanctuary' for a better life. The rooms and venue are lovely, the staff are helpful and sweet, buffet had some delicious treats, however I definately question the treatment of these elephants. They are chained up on quite small chains all around the grass. After questioning many staff members there, I was told that that is where they stay all day, and sleep there as well. Chains all day and night?? Part of our; ‚Ä¶

I stayed here with my family over 3 lodges. It was beautiful, very relaxing and a nice park. The lodge was very nice. The dinner taxi service (an elephant) was special. Bathing and swimming with the elephants was a highlight. It is a little expensive but it's something you don't get to do everyday.

title: Fantastic!!!
text: I stayed in one of the rooms which overlooked the elephants. It was rainy season and I just looked watching the elephants play in the rain, they seem genuinely happy. Spent 1 night here which gave us enough time to do the activities and relax a little. The lodge is not very busy which means they have the time to give you the best service. Rooms were clean with very large bathrooms! The chauffeur elephant ride from the balcony was a great experience. We also had some treatment in the spa which was just inner earth our room which was very relaxing and we were able to see the elephants from the windows I would recommend for families with children's lots of fun. However 2 nights and the park would be proficient (there isn't much around taro so you are secluded to the lodge)

title: Not To Be Missed
text: I stayed one night at this hotel and I had such a fun time. When you check in you are given a suggested itinerary for your stay. I was very excited and super keen and took part in every activity offered. I was travelling alone and was taken care of above and beyond expectations. I had an amazing swim with an elephant too - highly recommended - make sure you pack your bathing suit!! The hotel staff kindly arranged a driver to take me into Ubud for a tour - I had a great time and saw many wonderful things. I was taken to one of the scenes from the movie Eat, Pray, Love and toured many delightful shops in Ubud including a great silver jewellery store. If you have children or are looking for an up close and personal experience with real elephants don't go past this delightful; ‚Ä¶

title: The lodge itself...
text: I stayed three nights here and it exceeded my expectations! The rooms are beautiful and clean, the grounds are gorgeous and well maintained and the elephants! They are everywhere! The resort is very well set up with Westerners in mind, from the schedule to the accommodations. Very smart. All the staff are friendly and quick to help with any needs. There are enough activities to keep you busy all day from elephant bathing, swimming, safari rides, talent shows, and adventure sports. The elephants are so sweet and seem to enjoy interacting with the humans. From what I can tell, they are very well taken care of. I would come back here in a heartbeat!

date-review: Lisa S wrote a review Sep 2018
title: Well worth the money
text: I still have mixed feelings about this place. I had a great time during my visit, especially while washing the elephant and also feeding them, but the fact that they were chained made me feel sad. May be it is for the visitors safety, I do not know but it surely does not feel right.

date-review: David H wrote a review May 2018
title: Truly One of a Kind Experience. Elephants are rescued, Very Happy!!!
text: I thought that the lodge would be cruel to the elephants but they weren‚Äôt. They were treated very well. I got to swim, wash, feed and cuddle the elephants. There are many elephants and many softest things to do there. Highly recommend

title: Divided opinion
text: I took my almost four year old here. It was incredibly distressing to see the "new" baby in a tiny dirt pen with its mother, no comfort and too accessible to visitors. To watch tourists smirking and laughing while they ride these beautiful creautes in a filthy and small walking pool broke my heart. You could see how depressed the elephants are, being forced to "entertain". There is nothing "conservation" about this place. Please dont support this aweful place.

title: Very fun!
text: I understand the concept of the Safari Park and the need for elephant conservation .we stayed in the resort and we're able to experience every aspect of the daily lives of these amazing creatures such love and admiration for such extraordinary animals,however it is confronting when you realise that their life is to entertain thousands and thousands of tourists each month. I observed the way in which we as humans inter act with these extraordinary elephants and I do believe we are lucky to have such a place to connect. However it is a million dollar moneymaking venture and excessively overpriced . I believe they have lost the vision for this place and I felt like the Entire focus was on making as much money as possible out of every one !!! a very small portion of money goes; ‚Ä¶

I understand why those place is always busy / always well reviewed and consistently winning awards Nigel Mason has clearly built an empire that includes elephant sanctuary / hotel / white water rafting / cycling / jungle buggies / restaurants / spa / chocolate factory / bakery / catering etc etc But good luck to him and his family and his team......they‚Äôve clearly worked hard over many years and are fundamentally focused on quality.......... Amazing experience with the elephants - and of course they are working and they are there to entertain us tourists....that‚Äôs why we pay.....which gets the cynics and the critics twittering away with their negativity - but Nigel and his team rescued 25 plus elephants from a tough / tragic life in Sumatra and gave them the opportunity to; ‚Ä¶

date-review: Catherine C wrote a review Aug 2017
title: Over rated and over priced.
text: I visited the Elephant safari earlier this month and I was so excited I thought it was going to be the highlight of my trip. I left feeling really sad. Although I can see that the staff here are trying to conserve a species that is otherwise under massive threat I don't think this is the right way to do it. The whole thing is very rushed and impersonal. I did the jumbo wash option as I did not want to ride them. The elephants spend the whole day walking round the same loop giving guests rides and the baby ones just pose for photos constantly. when they are left unattended they are chained to the floor. I think the whole experience would be so much nicer if it was an actual 'safari' and the animals could roam free and you could take photos if they chose to come near you or maybe; ‚Ä¶

title: Elephant Safari Park is a tremendous experience!
text: I visited the Park thinking it would be far more like an African type territory / habitat than what it was but that was a mistake on my part and one that had no bearing on how wonderful this place was. The elephant ride went through lush tropical gardens and forest with my particular elephant doing various 'tricks' along the way such as playing a harmonica. The guide was very informative about the animals generally, the Safari Park and the specific elephant that we were on. He was very passionate about his Gigi. All the elephants there are 'rescued' Sumatran elephants and are very well cared for now. There is a chance to feed the elephants, come up close and personal and be hugged or adorned with a floral wreath by elephants and also to watch a 'clever' show they put on. It was; ‚Ä¶

I was applied at how nice the place looks. Very well manicured. I loved the greenery around the facility. The elephants looked well cared for and I like that there were no chains attached to their leg. It was very nice to interact with the elephants bath, feed and showed them affection. Lunch was nice also, several options to choose from. I would definitely go back. I also met Eka who work there. Very nice girl. Thanks for the bike ride. üòÜ lol. It was my first time on a scooter/motorcycle. Wifi is available but it wasn't stable for me. I kept having to re-login. Overall; I enjoyed my experience with the elephants. I wish there were enough people interested in the helicopter ride. I probably would have highly considered participating, since I never been in a helicopter before; ‚Ä¶

title: We fell in love with the Sumatran elephants here. What a great time!
text: I was extremely hesitant about visiting this place. However, It has always been my dream to see an elephant. The hotel it‚Äôs absolutely stunning, everything about the room was beautiful. The buffet style dinner was delicious better than expected. Staff was helpful and made sure we had a wonderful time. The reason why I am only giving this hotel 3 stars it‚Äôs because the elephants were chained, and people were riding them all day long. When I saw pictures of the hotel I thought the elephants were in a large open area where they could roam free, sadly I found out that was not the case. I saw one elephant that kept moving back and forth on his little chain and that broke my heart. Also I think it‚Äôs terrible that people were riding these elephants from the morning until late at night; ‚Ä¶

I was fortunate enough to visit the park recently and found that after 9 years shince my first visit, its only gotten better! More elephants have been relocated and there have been births, according kto my very informative mahout. This park is lovely

title: Great Experience!
text: I was looking for somewhere exclusive to surprise my long term partner whilst on holiday in Bali and through Trip Advisor, I came across this fantastic place. I entered dialog with Rudy, the wedding planner for Bali Adventure Tours. Together through emails, we managed to arrange everything without her knowledge. I asked Lorraine to marry me whilst having a sunset meal on the beach near Kuta on the 7th September, and informed her of the plans. She had always wanted to visit Bali from a child and the Elephant is her favourite animal. We stayed at the park for 2 x nights, the 11th & 12th September. When we arrived, we were blown away with this 5* accommodation. We had a park view room and spend hours looking and listening to the elephants both night and day. The morning of our; ‚Ä¶

I was nervous about going here. I really was. I was afraid I'd be crying about the elephants being mistreated the whole time. I was SO happy to see this was not the case. I will say seeing the elephants chained was upsetting at first, but if you actually read the information and talked to the trainers, you would learn that the Balinese government made it so that no refuge or anywhere elephants are held is allowed to have free ranging elephants. That is why they try to keep the elephants out a lot. So they get exercise, they get treats, they get stimulation. I couldn't believe how amazing this was. Everything was so perfect. Usually at places like this they try to cram in as many people as possible with having to provide the least amount of services possible. That is; ‚Ä¶

date-review: Patrick E wrote a review May 2019
title: Fantastic
text: I was not very keen on the idea of heading to an elephant park in Bali but I was convinced by my husband and our contact at buffalo tours who said that they refuse to take people places where animals are not ethically treated in Bali....and I was so suprised! The elephants were so well taken care of every one had been rescued (aside from the 2 babies 5&10yo) and would most defiantly be dead if they had not been rescued they are paired with a trainer who will work with them every day and they have formed an amazing bond with them. What some people are not realising is that elephants are a matriachal species where the males do not live with the females and having many different elephants from different heards can be very dangerous, females stay together from birth and all of these; ‚Ä¶

title: DO NOT VISIT
text: I was really excited at the chance to interact with elephants, so when we did you research, this place looked perfect. It was a sanctuary for rescued elephants that were happily roaming free. Well that wasn't the case at all! When we arrived first thing in the morning I looked around the park and all the elephants were chained up by their ankles looking distressed with the exception of a few who the people could interact with! When people were sat on the elephants in the water, we saw that the staff controlling the elephant was doing so with a key, and using this to stab into the back of their neck to get them to move in the direction that they wanted! The elephant rides were just as bad if not worse. The staff in charge of the elegant during the rides has a metal spike which; ‚Ä¶

title: incredible Opportunity
text: I was reluctant to spend the money on lodging at the park. It seemed awfully expensive. However, I am glad we splurged. The park is well run and has activities available constantly. We especially enjoyed getting to ride an elephant in the elephant swimming pool. We didn't know the it was possibility until we got up in the morning and another lodger told us about it. We would not have had the opportunity to bath an elephant, ride in the swimming pool, or get a ride to dinner, if we had not stayed the night. For us, it was worth every penny.

title: Interesting Ride
text: I was shocked at the treatment of these elephants and made a formal complaint as I noticed a few things that I would like to share. I do not want to stop people going here but after visiting to ask management in person or via a letter to improve on the condition of these elephants as I feel it is really the least we can do. Changes that should take place include: A free area (an area in which the elephants can be free to roam without being on a chain or in contact with humans) A five day week (currently the animals are worked 7days a week) Elephant to elephant contact (elephants are social animals, currently the elephants are kept at a distance as not to be able to make direct physical contact with kin) Shade (the elephants are chained in the open during the hottest parts of the; ‚Ä¶

title: Wondeful Experience
text: I was so saddened to go and see they use elephants in a show. What's more appalling is people were watching it. I'm afraid I left immediately. It's zero stars from me I can't condone this. Elephants are beautiful animals and should be shown the respect they so rightly deserve.

I was super excited to come here with my boyfriend, we researched everything before we came and seemed to see good reviews. We were greeted with welcome drinks and the staff were very friendly. The elephants picked us up from our room, as we looked around we could see that the elephants weren't free to roam and were chained up, we asked our guide why they chained them and his reason was because the elephants fight with each other , I'm not sure if I believe this. The guide took us to watch a "talent show" which really upset me as the elephants were forced to perform tricks, after there was a night safari ride which lasted about 10mins in which we paid about 2 million IDR (save your money) when we came off the elephant we saw that the guide was using a bull hook , I couldn't; ‚Ä¶

I went here for spending my honeymoon for 2D1N. Located on Taro Village and 30minutes away from central ubud. You need to rent a car if you want to central ubud. But personally, i would not recommend this place for your holiday. Because there's nothing so much to do here, and the price quite expensive. If you wanna stay there just because the elephant theme, please stay there. They provide you a great service.

I went here last year and did have a good time but there were aspects of this place I didn't like, for example all the elephants are permanently chained apart from during the bathing and riding. Secondly it didn't feel right riding an elephant and bull hooks are used to guide them which doesn't seem fair. Knowing more now about animal welfare I wouldn't advise coming here as it is all for the tourists, not for the elephants.

I went here with my friend for my birthday. Was such a great, unique experience. We washed and swam with the elephants, rode an elephant and then watched an elephant show. The staff were all very enthusiastic and friendly. You could tell the person who controlled the elephant we were riding on, loved the elephant very much (had been with it and training it for 10 years). I found the elephant show a little bit sad. There were also elephants chained up around the park.

title: Mrs Vanessa
text: I went to the Elephant Park yesterday and loved it. I'm always wary of animals being held captive as I think some places are cruel. I didn't feel like that here. The staff took their time to advise and show visitors their methods of training the elephants to keep their minds active. Once you've paid the entrance fee there are some lovely gardens to walk around where you can sit & watch the elephants and then there's a water area where they cool off, wash & you can (if you pay) ride one. Then if it's part of your package you can ride the beautiful creature around a "safari" area. I chose not to do this but many people did. There's a large gift shop, standard gift shop prices, a restaurant which I thought was over priced & a show arena. Every couple of hours 3 or 4 of the; ‚Ä¶

title: Probably the most unique hotel we've stayed at. The service from the staff was truly amazing!
text: I went to this beautiful park with my husband, mother, sister & friend.1st: the accommodation is 5 star, beautiful with lots of little touches you expect at a 5 star resort but don‚Äôt always get, well you get it there and then some. 2nd: the Staff are amazing so helpful and knowledgeable, most live in the local village, they will go that extra mile for you i.e. it was my sisters B-day, I asked for a b-day cake a dinner to celebrate, I said that I will pay for it they said no problem, on the night not only did they make us a yummy fresh b-day cake they told me that is was on the house, I also wanted to go for a swim with the elephants which they organised for me with not a lot of time to prepare.3rd: The Mahuls (the elephant riders) they are so interesting & gentle to speak with,; ‚Ä¶

I went with my son for ‚Äòbathe and breakfast with the elephants‚Äô! Because it was early, the elephants were in a clearing every one chained with 2/3metres length to move. They all looked miserable and 3 had festering wounds! Went for a ride on one and was reassured several times by the ‚Äòmahout‚Äô that it was good for the elephant!. Since learnt that weight on an elephants back can lead to deformities! Run by an Australian for profit. Very sad! Don‚Äôt go!

title: Loved it - so relaxing
text: I went with my wife, she's 24 and I'm 26 and we both had a great time, we didn't pay for the ride because each ticket was about 3 times more expensive than the normal one...and we didn't regret it. Even though we didn't ride them we were able to feed them, touch them and take side by side pictures...a great experience. It's very kid friendly, however we didn't see any children there and all the adults were having a great time. There is a 15min show were they show you the tricks they know and it's free so be sure to watch it. We spent 1 hour there and it was more than enough. Be sure to check it out!!

I will never support unethical experiences. The second we saw the chained elephants, we demanded a refund and left immediately. It is absolutely unacceptable to make a profit from chaining wild animals. Also, for those of you who don't really care about animals, the rooms were nothing special and the authenticity is not there. Don't waste your money.

I wish I had never visited this place as I mistakenly thought it was a sanctuary. The elephants are ridden, they use bullhooks to make them comply so you can have a selfie with a poor elephant. Please don‚Äôt go here.

i would not recommend anyone to stay there if you have any compassion for animals! As an animal lover i was really looking forward to staying there and interacting with there marvellous creatures in their habitat. However its completely different to what they show on their website! All the animals are constantly chained at their feet, and always looking nervous and uncomfortable as they try to get out of the chains :( Also saw the lodge staff pocking and hitting the elephants a few times to force them to do tricks and "behave" they way they wanted them too! Sooo disappointing, would never go back there again!!!! :(((

I would recommend this fantastic place to anybody who loves wildlife, especially elephants. It is the perfect sanctuary for these "rescued" Sumatran elephants and an even better place for visitors and guests to have "hands on" interaction with these beautiful creatures even with the 2 babies recently born there. The gardens are impeccable, the staff so helpful and friendly and the food excellent. Our 2 nights at the Elephant Safari Park Lodge were spent in a beautifully decorated room overlooking the elephants and we can say without doubt that this was the best experience ever. It was the highlight of our trip to Bali.

title: Immaculate
text: I would recommend this fantastic place to anybody who loves wildlife, especially elephants. It is the perfect sanctuary for these "rescued" Sumatran elephants and an even better place for visitors and guests to have "hands on" interaction with these beautiful creatures even with the 2 babies recently born there. The gardens are impeccable, the staff so helpful and friendly and the food excellent. Our 2 nights at the Elephant Safari Park Lodge were spent in a beautifully decorated room overlooking the elephants and we can say without doubt that this was the best experience ever. It was the highlight of our trip to Bali.

I wouldn't have missed this experience for anything. An absolute highlight not just of Bali but anywhere I have ever visited before. To be there as a family it was unforgettable and so special. From the elephant ride to just watching them graze in the gardens in front of our lodge and then seeing my daughter swim with them in the morning was truly magical. Even if you don't stay overnight I would still urge everyone to at least visit.

If you don't go there you will regret! It's absolutly amazing. The ride on the elephant, it's more expensive. We had only accomodation in the elephant park, but we enjoy it anyway. You can see the elephant in showroom, take a milion photos of you&elephants and feed elephants. I will never forget this experience.

date-review: Georgia H wrote a review Jan 2012
title: Worthwhile addition
text: If you like animals and what to visit somewhere that can assist them, this is the place. I believe that what they are doing at the Elephant Safari and Park Lodge is only for the benefit of Sumatran Elephants, unfortunately experiencing diminishing habitats and food supply as they are competing with Indonesian farmers. All the elephants seemed well looked after and happy. The park certainly do a lot to teach children to appreciate and respect animals and nature...

If you like going to a circus where bears do tricks well this is your thing. As previous reviews have stated it is marketed as a sanctuary, rescued elephants losing their habit in Sumartra. So now they are brought into the park to be bossed around and chained up and told to behave with human commands all day long. The park has even used Steve Erwin's name as endorsement. He would not like what is happening there now. Oh and the "free time" area is under construction. They are wild animals and need a real sanctuary. Just came away angry.

date-review: prettysia s wrote a review Jul 2020
title: Extraordinary
text: If you love animals or elephants do not visit. They abuse the animals with bull hooks this is not a sanctuary and should be closed down. Really sad to see the poor elephants in the state and so many believe its to help them

date-review: prettysia s wrote a review Jul 2020
title: Extraordinary
text: If you love animals or elephants do not visit. They abuse the animals with bull hooks this is not a sanctuary and should be closed down. Really sad to see the poor elephants in the state and so many believe its to help them

title: Amazing Reservation
text: If you love elephants and want to interact with them closey, this is a fantastic opportunity to cuddle, wash and bathe with them. Elephants are not indigenous to Bali, so these elephants are domesticated elephants (think work horses) that have been rescued from a near certain death in Sumatra. The Sumatran elephant is an endangered species and park owner and operator, Nigel Mason, has had the vision to rescue some 30 elephants and to create this sanctuary. The elephants are clearly doing well as four baby elephants have been produced in the park. The hotel is a fine establishment with great staff, but if you are not into elephants you may wish to stay elsewhere. The park is not huge, but very well kept and maintained with wonderful immacculate greenery. The characterful; ‚Ä¶

date-review: Athina V wrote a review Feb 2019
title: Must Do!
text: If you love elephants, this should be top of your Bali must do list. I recommend the whole package, Full Buffett breakfast overlooking the elephants bathing pond, then slip into your swim gear and ride the elephants into the bath pond and scrub them down after, then give them a feed. Most importantly you can walk around the grounds and see where they are housed. These great creatures are treated very well and endorsed by so many visiting celebrities.

title: Visit to Mason elephant lodge in Bali
text: If you want a genuine experience of elephant ride , the sanctuary so called is some how a well organised factory in a beautiful location incredibly well looked after . Yet , it is volume driven and stacks of people and guided in the most optimised way to take their elephant ride as quickly as possible (30 min) on a set path with million people ahead and behind on a set path around the sanctuary . They pretend to be a sanctuary ü§î? Nothing as such ! Elephants are tied up with a small chain and submissive to food only , which they seem to get on a regular basis . The meal offered is rather mediocre and a drink is not even included . You can be guided into feeding the elephants yet all is well staged and under control . Not a very genuine experience as we were sold ! And mix; ‚Ä¶

title: booked for the kids, but the grown-ups enjoyed it too!
text: If you want to get to know elephants, feed,and wash them and just be there with them Elephant Safari Park Lodge is the place to have a hands on Experience of a life time.We stayed 2 nites for us that is the time you need to enjoy the thrill of being in the company of the elephants 24/7 to go sit on your balcony and they are right in front of you is fantastic,wake up thru the nite make a cuppa and sit absorb their presence is out of this world. The Park is a pleasure to experience, the beauty of the gardens, the peace & tranquility is to be enjoyed the breakfast to die for and the staff well they are so very helpful and always they have their beautiful smile that lights up your day. The accommodation is superb The whole experience completed my dream in a beautiful Way. We were; ‚Ä¶

If you want to interact with elephants, then stay at the Elephant Safari Park Lodge. And I do mean stay here -- the absolute best part about staying is that you get to assist in the daily morning scrubbing of the elephants, not an option for day visitors. For a full hour you can scrub an adult elephant with a brush and hose -- they enjoy it, and it's an amazing experience. Residents and day visitors can also have the fun of feeding treats to adult and young elephants, taking rides on elephants, and hanging out in the area where the three youngsters are with their mothers. Being with the elephants was priceless. If you are looking for a good resort experience, however, this place falls a short. The staff is friendly and helpful, but not always very effective. There were; ‚Ä¶

If you want to ride elephants, go to Chiang Mai, Thailand instead. This hotel was a very big disappointment. *Rooms were no better than a low end 2-star hotel. *Rooms were very very dank and musty. *Lighting was terrible. *Water in rooms went out multiple times (including in the middle of my shower). *There is insufficient bottled water in rooms to brush teeth. *Web site for property is deceptive. It is not "just a few kilometers from Ubud. It is minimum 45 minute drive. *No taxi's are available to take people to town, so if you stay at this hotel, you are stuck there. *The food at the hotel was inedible. *A soda (coke) cost US$5 in the hotel. *Rooms are not at all sound proof. Can hear "everything" in adjacent rooms. *They begin using power tools for gardening at 5AM; ‚Ä¶

title: Fabulous, enjoyable, quite remarkable part of our first Bali trip
text: Im a massive elephant fan so seeing elephants was the main reason for the trip so my travel agent had reccomended this. I wish I had stayed in the lodges because they are amazing. But i was just there for the day trip. The place is so clean and well looked after a breath of fresh air from staying in Kuta. I was picked up from my hotel and driven to the park. A child we were traveling with became car sick in the car and the driver did not become mad at all just cleaned it up and off we went. Theres botanical gardens that you walk through to get to the elephants.
