I told the handler it was ok for him to eat which was just brushed off. We witnessed a baby elephant chained up and he was obviously distressed rocking side to side and making strange sounds. What a life!! I couldn't wait to leave there and will not return. Don't go there, yes it's a novelty riding an elephant, but at what cost?!

title: Impressed
text: We were a little hinky about the elephant preserve going into it, and while many have belabored the point of the ethics of such a place, I'll leave it at this - Mason's grounds are spacious, safe and beautiful. The handlers are gentle and knowledgeable. The elephants are ravenous for sweet potatoes, carrots and fruit. Having an elephant adeptly and gently take a piece of a carrot out of your hand is pretty amazing. Being able to brush and run your hands along the flank of a 3 ton elephant who is unchained is magical. Riding an elephant wasn't our thing, and "bathing" with an elephant wasn't either (too much poo in the water), but the experience was extremely memorable for all the right reasons.

title: Great care for Elephants
text: We were greeted and accompanied by wonderful people and even made some friends. The hotel service exceeded our expectations. One thing that I did not enjoy was the elephant rides. Though the lodge rescue these animals and take great care of them I would rather not do this activity. We spoke to many of the elephant keepers and we were around the elephants enough to see that they are really well taken care off. The food!!!! we have traveled to many places and it's not always easy to find food that is truly delicious. You do not have to look to far, this is it. Overall I would rate this as a 5star experience and we will be returning to let our family enjoy this experience with us.. Thank you Mason Elephant Lodge and staff.

title: A Unique Experience
text: We were guests at this delightful Resort from 3/6/2010 to 6/6/2010. It was a "life changing experience". We were so impressed with the attention to detail, the care given to the elephants ,the quality of the facilities, the comfort of our room and the wonderful service given by the friendly staff. The thrill to get to know these beautiful creatures, both big and small. Where else can one be collected at 7pm by your own mahout and elephant and transported to "silver service dining", under the stars, in the Palm Grove? Our only regret is that we didnt stay longer. Do your self a favour and visit.

title: Loved the experience!
text: We were picked up around 0630am and taken to the lodge from our hotel in Ubud. The park was clean and the operators very professional. We had a good time scrubbing our elephant before being amazed by our swim with the elephants. ( make sure you change into swimming gear first as you get wet abd will shower immediately after ) the breakfast after was delicious. We then got to go on a small ride on the Elephant around the park before watching a short talent show where the elephants do some painting and basketball etc. You could purchase little fruit bowels for 50000 IDR to feed the elephants with also which was a neat experience in its self. You can tell the operators care about the elephants and don't over work them. One of the highlights from our holiday and would highly; ‚Ä¶

title: Elephant Safari Lodge
text: We were so excited to visit the elephant safari after being recommended to go by a few people in our hotel. Entrance to the park was expensive even without paying to ride them as we said we would decide once we were in there if we wanted to or not (thank god we didn't). As soon as we walked in after paying nearly 600 IDR we were told by a staff member to go into the merchandise store and use the restaurant (not very welcoming). The park seemed nice until we got closer to the elephants who all seemed extremely sad and chained up with stupid saddles on their backs. You then had to pay more to feed them which to be fair we happily did as we felt like at least we were giving them something by feeding them. The staff that worked their were brutal. Forcing the elephants to pose for; ‚Ä¶

We were so pleased we went to this elephant park in Bali. The staff are so friendly and are so happy to take pictures of you with the elephants and to show you how to feed them etc... feeding the elephants was such a highlight and learning about these amazing animals was just fantastic. We paid for the elephant safari but looking back we wouldn't do it again and were quite happy just feeding and watching the elephants. The safari is ok to say you have rode an elephant but you literally just go around a circle of trees and it isn't much of a sight and I spent most of the journey flicking giant ants off of me after the trainer told me they bite!

date-review: Melissa T wrote a review Dec 2017
title: Conditions for elephants should be improved
text: We were there with children. Elephants either chained with minimal movement options or rigged to take tourists for a ride. We asked about the chaining and were told that if unchained they would fight..... but that begs the question how zoos around the World have unchanined elefants. Tjat area was tiny. I got the impression from the web that this place puts the elefants welfare first and choose it because of that - but it honestly in My personal oppinion seems more like a marketing gimmick. I would NOT reccomend this place!

title: DO NOT VISIT !!!!!!
text: We were under the impression that this was an elephant sanctuary... we were happy to pay for an expensive night as we thought that the money would be going to the care of the elephants... but it is a luxury resort, elephants are chained up and have people riding them most if the time... when we looked up reviews we were under the impression that there was not riding of the elephants and that you got to spend your time feeding, washing and looking after them, this is not the case. You have to pay to feed them and bath them on top of the already expensive nights stay. Ultimately this is a place for rich people to ride elephants and stay in there rooms watching them chained to a small area swaying and looking pretty miserable....

title: Bathe and breakfast with the elephants
text: We were unsure about visiting an Elephant sanctuary but after doing our homework we decided the Sanctuary at Ubud was the best option. The elephants are well cared for and clearly loved by the staff. Every elephant has their own keeper who stay with that elephant. Our beautiful female Elephant called Pusbar was 42 and had the same keeper for 15 years. The Sanctuary is well kept and clean and has a nice restaurant . The Elephant trek lasted about 30 minutes and was worth every penny. Downsides The elephants do have a single chain around their hind leg when not participating in the treks, and there was a show which we didn't watch.

date-review: Ken L wrote a review Feb 2017
title: Elephants
text: We when here with our 5 year old and it was great we got to feed the elephants and to see the show. We did not ride one as we felt bad as it seems that they are doing that all day. Poor things.... the park is good and clean. We had lunch there and it was ok. I was feeling quite sick afterwards. The food for the elephants cost around $5. Overall good experience...

date-review: Kerrie M wrote a review Sep 2017
title: What a beautiful place.
text: We will never forget our visit here. The Elephant ride was a first for us and one off our bucket list. Especially going through the water. My advice wear sensible shoes, I wore flip flops and felt I might lose them at any time. Our guide was amazing and answered all our questions. The Elephants are rescued and look well looked after and content. Feeding the Elephants was our favourite part of our visit and the elephant trainer took some wonderful photos with my phone and camera for us. If you like Elephants you will love a visit here no matter what age you are.

title: Bleeding elephants! Do not go here!
text: We won't ever forget the two nights we spent here. We stayed in the Padi view rooms - lovely views - really tranquil in elegant surroundings. Being amongst the elephants was a wonderful experience. All the staff were focussed on making our stay memorable and enjoyable. Their love for the elephants was obvious. The experiences we had with the elephants were beyond what we expected. Prior to the visit we had read of concerns people had regarding the elephants' welfare, so we were concerned about this when we arrived. However, after staying here, we have absolutely no doubts that the care and welfare of the elephants is of the highest priority and we will never forget our experiences here. Two major highlights were swimming with the elephants (twice) and being picked up by the; ‚Ä¶

We would recomend this hotel to anyone. We stayed here as part of our honeymoon and it could not have been any more perfect. We felt like we were celebrities, nothing was too much trouble. The elephant safari was excellent and as guests we could go at the time that suited us and being picked up from our own balcony. Our favourite hotel ever.

We, a 3-generation family of 6 stayed two nights in park view rooms. Any misgivings we may have had about zoos, elephants in captivity, limited options ‚Äì were quickly dispelled. This is a beautifully landscaped park with gentle elephants that are clearly well cared for and are not over-worked. Watching a family of three elephants playing together in the pool in front of the restaurant will remain for us an enduring memory. Captivity is never better than the wild, but many of these elephants have been rescued from far worse conditions. The mahouts are friendly and knowledgeable, have been with their elephants for many years and are obviously very caring. The staff generally are very attentive and efficient. Food in the restaurant is good, the museum and gallery interesting and; ‚Ä¶

We‚Äôve been to natural Elephant sanctuary in Thailand. The Mason Lodge treats their elephants with extraordinary care, LOVE and kindness. I was skeptical at first, but they won me over. These are Happy Elephants . Highly recommend this for at least one nights stay to commiserate with these gentle giants!! Blessings to Nigel! Thanks

title: I feel bad for the Elephants :(
text: Well cared for elephants, rescued from Sumatra. Very well organised park. Tickets can be purchased to visit, or visit and ride an elephant, adding lunch in the restaurant or drinks and snacks sold in the cafe. Lots of outside seating, sit in the comfortable huts and watch an information video in English if the park and founder. Watch a live 15 min show performed by the elephants. Excellent for couples and families alike, staff are willing to take photographs of your experience or you can purchase a disc of your trip.

date-review: Yelena M wrote a review Apr 2015
title: Above and beyond!
text: Well this place is just fantastic. All of the comments below are true. Swimming with the elephants was magical. The buffet, although pricey by indonesia standards was submime. Grilled fresh tuna, fish curry, rare beef salad, mmmmm. My advice is to arrive exactly at check in as they create a full itinerary for you from the moment you arrive. Absolutely top quality rooms, great service and as has already been mentioned lots, the animals truly look happy and well cared for.

date-review: zane p wrote a review May 2017
title: Best trip in Bali
text: Well this was well worth the money the views the elephant safari feeding the elephants and their daily shows was so exciting and enjoyable in Bali the fee included a fantastic lunch time meal we did t need anything for the rest of the day apart from a snack but there are botanical gardens elephant ride was the highlight of the tour as well as feeding them

Went here first thing of my birthday day. A bit choked when I saw the elephants separated and in chains. Then one by one they take the chains off. They initially took one chilled elephant called Eva for us to wash. I was trying to hold back tears, it was a very moving, humbling experience! To see them eye to eye, see them staring back at you.... almost spiritual! Then we were then taken to a pool. Another group of super chillax elephants, this is where they get really wet and they submerge themselves. I promise you you will get wet so bring a spare set of clothes. We didn't want the bfast and the animal show so we had just wander around the park. Heartbreaking to see the elephants still carrying humans on their back! Then one by one all the elephants are loose, following around; ‚Ä¶

title: Great work!
text: Went to check out the Sumatran elephants. What magnificant creatures they are. Did'nt do an elephant ride because I think it's not the best way to safe them. Nice parc, Well maintained. Entry fee is high, considering you only walk around the parc. But you can have interaction with the elephants if you want to

Went to the park today for a wash and lunch. When we got there it is full of pictures of celebrities who are having a great time. Once you go into the park it is full of animal abuse, every handler has something sharp to pinch the elephants with if the don't listen and the animals are forced to do as the handler say. Elephants that are not being used to entertain tourists are just chained in a small sand circle with only about 2 meter chains. THIS IS NOT A SANCTUARY!!!!

title: Elephant-sized fun!
text: Went with my husband and 15 year old daughter. We all loved it. My husband said it was a highlight for him getting to touch feed and ride an elephant. Very clean well run place. I normally feel funny going to places like this because the animals are not in their natural environment. These elephants have been rescued and are Sumatra elephants and yes you get that funny feeling should I be doing this but the place is so well run and the elephants seem happy you leave feeling blessed to have experienced it üêòüêòüêòüêò Totally recommend.

title: Elephants Don't Have Great Lives!
text: What a awesome experience. Have two teenagers with me and it's so good to see there faces light up and laughs when experiencing the 30min ride on the elephants. The staff are friendly and encourage you to Pat and get photos next to the elephants. Be aware though if you get to close they start flapping there ears and your face/head is right next to it! Harmless but can give you a fright. If you want to ride the elephants remember to take your ticket as they call your name out first before you line up. So do not get in line unless called. Souvenir shop awesome and reasonable plus already priced. We all enjoyed our day a must to see and do in Ubud.

title: Looks good, feels fake
text: What a fantastic place, if you are thinking of coming here book it now and make sure you book a park view room...after all you are going here to look at elephants not a garden or paddy field! We stayed for 2 nights and could have probably done 3. Although pricey I feel the honeymoon package was worth the money, and all facilities including the river rafting really were top notch. This is well planned and designed resort with 5 star finishing throughout. On arrival my wife was extremely ill and the lady at the front of house was very helpful...she arranged for a driver to collect medicine from Ubud and fortunately by the evening she had recovered to enjoy a fabulous buffet dinner. We are not big fans of buffet style eating, but this one was amazing. The food included a range of; ‚Ä¶

title: Heart breaking
text: What a fun amazing day very peaceful and relaxing! Riding the elephants is just incredible. You just couldn't complain about the day! The buffet lunch was great and gift shop was really well priced with cool lil bits and pieces you can't find elsewhere. Elephant shows were really cool and they seem really happy and well treated!!

What a fun day! When you sign up for breakfast and bathing the elephants you get more than you bargain for. I totally wasn‚Äôt expecting the breakfast to be more than a continental one, however it was filled with flaky, soft croissants and pastries, to bacon, eggs and fresh juices. After eating you get to scrub these gentle giants down, while snapping pictures. Over in the pond you get to mount one and ride it into the water with them. Hold on or squeeze your legs tightly against them because you will be submerged into the water unexpectedly. Don‚Äôt worry, your head will not get wet. I didn‚Äôt chose the option to ride the elephants because having breakfast, bathing and playing with them was good enough for me. Enjoy yourself!

date-review: Fatima R wrote a review Oct 2017
title: Elephant ride
text: What a great place to stay. Stayed 2 nights .The rooms are beautiful with a great clean bathroom. Air conditioning is a great welcome. Each evening the elephant picks you up at your lodge to take you to evening meal. You can wash the baby elephant in the morning. It's a great place all the elephant are well looked after. I would recommend going to get the experience. We loved it. There was nothing bad about this place. The staff are do caring and friendly. We will be hoping again.

title: Unique experience but not cheap
text: What a great way to spend a few days! The room was lovely but we weren't in a position to catch a ride on an elephant to take us to dinner as we had a Paddy room. Not a disappointment though as we had plenty of opportunity to view, hand feed, wash and interact with the elephants. Fantastic for kids and adults alike, thoroughly recommend.

What a wonderful caring park for the rescued elephants. I was a little I sure at first however after seeing for myself and chatting to the keepers you realise there is a lot of care and attention in this particular elephant park. It‚Äôs a rescue centre, and it‚Äôs clear they‚Äôre all passionate about the elephants here. It‚Äôs a wonderful community. Also if you have the option to eat there, do! Food is great, fresh, tasty and caters very well for all dietary needs inc gluten free. Will certainly revisit again next year. Thank you for taking such wonderful gentle care of my toddler who was a little unsure at first due to the size of the wonderful creatures, however by the end was happy to feed the elephants all the fruits and veg we could get our hands on.

date-review: Heinrich U wrote a review Aug 2020
title: Song of the giants.
text: What a wonderful experience my girlfriend and I had this past weekend. The park and facilities are outstanding, the staff are wonderful and very helpful. The restaurant items were superb and delicious, far superior to many other restaurants in Bali. The elephants are incredible, gentle, happy, playful, healthy, and majestic intelligent creatures. The complimentary elephant ride from our room to the restaurant was so delightful. Bathing the elephants, swimming with them, feeding them was such a dream come true. I am truly humbled by their presence and gentle nature. The baby elephants are so cute and playful. It felt like we were staying at Jurassic Park with Elephants, the park layout is so well planned and beautiful. The rooms are excellent with incredible views of the; park. Please note that this park treat the elephants humanely with integrity and caring. Disregard the negative reviews from uneducated guests, any questions you have the staff are there to help you understand the terrible circumstances from which these animals came from. Please support this fantastic sanctuary as CoVid has affected their ability to expand and grow. A special thanks to Brad, Ketut and Lenny for their extra special care and hospitality, it was an absolute pleasure being under your care!!; ‚Ä¶

date-review: Heinrich U wrote a review Aug 2020
title: Song of the giants.
text: What a wonderful experience my girlfriend and I had this past weekend. The park and facilities are outstanding, the staff are wonderful and very helpful. The restaurant items were superb and delicious, far superior to many other restaurants in Bali. The elephants are incredible, gentle, happy, playful, healthy, and majestic intelligent creatures. The complimentary elephant ride from our room to the restaurant was so delightful. Bathing the elephants, swimming with them, feeding them was such a dream come true. I am truly humbled by their presence and gentle nature. The baby elephants are so cute and playful. It felt like we were staying at Jurassic Park with Elephants, the park layout is so well planned and beautiful. The rooms are excellent with incredible views of the; park. Please note that this park treat the elephants humanely with integrity and caring. Disregard the negative reviews from uneducated guests, any questions you have the staff are there to help you understand the terrible circumstances from which these animals came from. Please support this fantastic sanctuary as CoVid has affected their ability to expand and grow. A special thanks to Brad, Ketut and Lenny for their extra special care and hospitality, it was an absolute pleasure being under your care!!; ‚Ä¶

date-review: Ric S wrote a review Aug 2016
title: Anniversary Holiday
text: What a wonderful experience to see a Sun Bear who actually sat on my knee..he weighted 65 kilos. It was the most magical moment and the elephants were amazing. I had heard about the bear but to actually see and feel them was the best.Would recommend to anyone to make the effort to see them

What a wonderful experience, the best was swimming with the elephants. We got a deal through one web site only to have another website do a better deal for $400 less. Without a deal this place would be too expensive to stay at. The food can be expensive, buffet lunch is 200,000IDR for adults and 100,000IDR for kids but dinner buffet is $30 USD and kids $20USD ‚Äì so some things are USD and some rupiah, not sure why. Cocktails are about $14 AUD so not cheap for Bali we stayed two nights which is plenty

date-review: G√°bor S wrote a review Sep 2016
title: interaction with elephants was amazing!!!
text: What a wonderful place to visit. Started with a beautiful buffet lunch, then photos with the elephants. The trainers are so welcoming and take the time to let you feed and take photos with all the elephants big and small. Our ride was unforgettable, it poured with rain half way through but they were organized with umbrellas on board. After our ride on our elephant we got to watch the show. The are incredibly intelligent. Would definitely go again..

date-review: Karina W wrote a review Mar 2016
title: Incredible experience
text: What a wonderful place! Elephants rescued from a nearby island where elephants are still not safe from ivory hunters, the animals at the park are paired with a human for their lifetimes. They are well cared for and seem to be really loved and treated as buddies rather than beasts. We rode [the elephants do only two trips per day then play] and loved going through forest trails this way. Then we played a bit [under supervision of course] with 'baby elephants' who were gigantic and adorable and gentle. What a charming experience. And hopeful! that animals can be well treated by humans. A buffet lunch is included in the ticket price.

What an absolutely amazing and awesome experience to swim and wash these gorgeous gentle animals. These elephants are treated so well and it was my pleasure to be able to do this. I will certainly do it again when I go back. Loved it so much

title: A Stunning Safari Experience
text: What an amazing experience, so after visiting the elephants in Thailand we were shocked an thrightened to visit a place with elephants again, they were beaten, under fed, and we was subject to a small stompeed which scared me to absolute death, so being cautious to the negative reviews we had read about the Mason Lodge I can honestly say the treatment and care here is outstanding after seeing how they were treated in thailand compared to here... just wow, the elephants are constantly fed a variety of vegetation and fruit. They are pampered throughout the day getting bathed, cleaned and fed, in which we could take part in, the elephants are exercised regularly ether walking ether themselves or with there personal trainers some of which have been with the elephants for over 20; ‚Ä¶

date-review: Dasha M wrote a review Oct 2012
title: ANIMAL CRUELTY!!
text: What an amazing hotel. I recently travelled to the Elephant safari lodge with my husband and two children 4 and 2. We only stayed one night and that was fine for our age children From the moment we arrived we felt welcome including a personal escort to our room by a friendly staff member. That night it was so exciting because we got picked up from our room and taken to dinner by elephant. The look on my daughters face was priceless. We then woke in the morning to a lovely breakfast plus more elephant interaction including cleaning the elephants and my husband even swam with them. We then were picked up from our room by elephant again to go for another ride.It is so funny when the phone rings to tell you your elephant will be soon arriving. It was AMAZiNG. My daughter has shown; ‚Ä¶

date-review: Will H wrote a review Apr 2018
title: Best experience
text: What an amazing place! After seeing Nigel Mason‚Äôs doco on how he rescued the elephants, all I can say is ‚ÄòI am totally impressed‚Äô. The elephants are happy, not mistreated and their handlers have been with them for years. The lodge, dinner and all the facilities are first class and couldn‚Äôt recommend this highly enough. It was the highlight of our trip. We can‚Äôt wait to return. Well done to all the staff.

What an amazing way to finish a trip to Bali. We stayed just two nights prior to departing Bali. It is about 30 min from the main shopping area to Ubud. They have a shuttle that runs twice a day into town otherwise it is $27 USD round trip. The place is amazingly clean with all the wonderfully kept elephants. We had an amazing time with the gently giants. I do recommend the morning bath and feeding time as this is for hotel guest only. At time is can be busy with tour groups. I did the swimming with Elephants. The water is gross but who could resist a once in a lifetime chance to swim with an elephant. I figured the elephants eat organically so what could happen. The staff like most of Bali were wonderful. The AC was just adequate. The room was large and comfortable.

date-review: Malcolm C wrote a review Nov 2015
title: Family holiday highlight
text: What an excellent day photos with a lion elephants a good family day out . Food reasonable priced . The safari drive around the park was enjoyed by all the staff very friendly and helpful . This is a great place to bring your family or on your own

title: Great day out
text: What can be better than sitting at breakfast watching elephants as they have their breakfast (though it seems they are always eating!) and their handlers prepare for the day? The park is incredibly beautiful filled with lush foliage, flowers, koi ponds and statues of the Hindu Diety Ganesha. The food is delicious, accommodations uniquely wonderful and the service impeccable. Of course the stars are the elephants Bathing them, while feeding them orchid flowers and riding them as they bathed in the pond was a bucket list experience that everyone should experience at least once in their lifetime. We plan to one day return.

What can i say what a great place to go and spent time with awesome animals and the staff. They put on a show with the elephants then we went on a ride so relaxing just walking in the bush . If you come to bali its a must see

When we arrived, we were sad to seethe elephants chained. However it was evening, the next day the elephants were being bathedby guests and swimming with them. We just loved it, the elephants were obviously very well cared for and the relationship between the mahouts and the elephants was heart warming. We saw the elephants walking round all day yes at times carrying guests but lets face it, these elephants were rescued from logging etcand the weight of two guests is nothing to them. We watched 4 elephants play in thewater alone with mahouts nearby, they looked so relaxed and well cared for. It truly was a magical place that does its best for the elephants. I acknowledge somethings arent perfect, but this is real life not Disney and this place provides a safe home where they are; ‚Ä¶

When you have been in Bali as long as I have for 19 years and lived in my 1,200 m2 ¬© Bali Luxury Villa plus travelled the world staying at some the finest hotels I am frankly hard to impress. Yesterday I experienced the Bali Elephant Safari Park run by the very successful Bali Adventure Tours owned and operated by long time Bali expatriate Nigel Mason and his lovely wife Yanie. Years ago I had experienced their elephant walk which was enjoyable. This time I was invited by Yanie to enjoy the elephant walk and to stay overnight at the Lodge built in recent years. Frankly at first I turned down the offer for the Lodge because after all I live in a huge modern 6 bedroom mansion only an hour and a half away on the beach and would miss my private Jacuzzi and pool. Out of curiosity; ‚Ä¶

Where to begin - the safari lodge exceeded all expectation. It is incredibly well put together, the park itself is beautiful (if a bit remote - although they do run free shuttles to and from ubud a few times a day). Everything is elephant-centric down to the smallest detail (elephant legs for the bed frame, historical paintings depicting the treatment of elephants in the breakfast room, elephant museum) and everything is very well thought out and put together. Elephant tourism, and animal tourism in general, has become somewhat contentious, but I felt the elephants were well cared for and had a far nicer life at the lodge than they would in most other instances. They seemed playful and happy, squirting water over tourists and bathing multiple times a day. Bathing with the; ‚Ä¶

date-review: Mary S wrote a review Oct 2019
title: Gorgeous Elephants
text: While its not particularly nice to see the elephants chained in their respective circles to eat, it is incredible that there is a haven like this for guests and rescued Sumatran elephants. The owner Nigel Mason is the first to admit very openly that in a perfect world, these animals would be in the wild. Seeing the museum photos of the horrible Sumatran containment camps where these animals were chained and living before coming here is heartbreaking. Kudos to all those involved for making it a reality and I wish there were more places like this as options for these gentle giants. Its like walking into a movie set from jurasic park- big wooden doors, lush tropical landscape and friendly staff to care for your every wish. I give them 5 stars for the printed itinerary, the; ‚Ä¶

date-review: Sarah A wrote a review Mar 2019
title: Mixed Feelings
text: While on vacation with our group of 9 we came across this tour offered by TripAdvisor. I will say this was one of the best tours we had booked in the 14 days we were there . The elephants were so well taken care of and you could tell they were so happy . Our tour included Bath the elephants Feed the elephants.. including the young ones. Ride in the swimming lake as well the safari ride . This also included the Buffett breakfast The entire park was so impressive from start to finish We even got to have a short chat with the founders Do not miss this when you travel to Bali !!!

While staying in Ubud for a recent family holiday we decided to visit the Elephant Park, some 45 minutes away. Our hotel suggested the morning feed, wash and bath with the Elephants was a unique experience worth trying. An early hotel pickup found us at the Elephant park at around 7.30am. After helping scrub the elephants we had the pleasure of riding on their backs while they had their morning swim...what a thrill. Bathers definitely the order of the day. Watch out for the floating coconuts! This was followed by a quick shower, then breakfast. While the breakfast was relatively basic, it was more than adequate. After watching the morning elephant show we had a elephant ride around the park, before the bus ride back to the home. While the whole morning was relatively; ‚Ä¶

While visiting Bali all my 4 year old wanted to do was ride and elephant. So I looked into it and found Elephant Safari Park and Lodge in Taro. We had our driver take us out there after stopping in Ubud. Driving to Taro you truly get to see the quiet Balinese villages and their way of life out of the hustle and bustle. The park was cheap for entry but riding an elephant is around $100US per adult. Kids 4 and under are classed as infants so it's pretty cheap. I highly recommend booking online as I think it's a bit cheaper. The park was quite in the afternoon when we arrived. We needed lunch so headed to the restaurant where they have a great menu and the food is really nice. I'm not sure what I was expecting to be honest. I thought being a sanctuary the elephants where able to; ‚Ä¶

title: Amazing!
text: While zoos are fun this one is just way too expensive and I feel like they mickle and dime you to death. It's not the same without the tram - you really just can't see enough animals to make it worth the price.

Wish we could have stayed longer here, because it is such a unique experience. The lodge is situated in magnificent gardens and parkland, and as Taro is in the highland part of Bali, the climate here made a welcome change from the humidity on the coast. We were greeted with friendly smiles at check in, which was done in no time at all, and then escorted to our room. There are a approximately six steps up to the rooms (this is so there is ease of access onto the elephant when you are collected), so I think anybody with disabilities would find it challenging. Rooms are "elephant themed", everything has elephants on them, be it lamps, bed covers, cushions, even the bed legs are carved as an elephants foot. High quality furnishings throughout. It was a nice touch to have paintings; ‚Ä¶

title: Great Trip!
text: With a rich heritage of celebrities attending the safari you are certain this trip will be unforgettable. With excellent friendly staff that will protect and give you an exclusive tour round a enclosed forrest you will never want to get off the elephant. Elephants that are named after the football players it was a great display that they can paint like Picasso with their own paint brush and canvas. Be sure to get wet and be sure the elephant will drop a few dungs of leftover, you will have your son who would not want to leave the safari park after a great photo shot of this journey.

title: Amazing!
text: Wonderful time, education about the Sumatra Elephants their long time caretakers Have 1 elephant. The caretakers we met had been with the same elephant many years. They are chained for their safety between themselves and damage to surrounding village farms. They work the elephants ( like walking your dog) by taking guest to dinner and walks around the jungle. Guest have the opportunity to brush and bathe them. As well as take them for a dip in the pond. Riders only get wet up to mid chest and Showers and changing availability. Grounds of the elephant lodge and park beautiful.Food was excellent. Rooms are elevated (stairs) so the elephants come to get you for dinner and walks. Rooms spacious and Comfy. Spa had great couple massages Staff was excellent!; ‚Ä¶

title: Everyone should visit once!
text: Words cannot describe this place. This is the second time I have stayed and it will not be the last. If you have a love for animals and in particular Elephants then you simply have to go to this place the food, rooms and gardens are magnificent and the elephants are all in great condition and their mahouts obvious love for them is clear to see. This time we stayed in a park view room and to wake up surround by 30 elephant is an experience not to be missed. My advice is that you must stay at this place overnight to experience that entire place. The bathing the elephants in the morning is the highlight and the chance to spend time one on one with these most noble of creatures is an experience I will never forget. I cannot express what special place this is. I was generally sad; ‚Ä¶

title: A wonderful experience to remember dearly.
text: Wow what a wonderful day...Elephant rides, shows, great food and all round great experience.. I rode and fed the Elephants the handlers were fantastic assisting with selfies..definately worth tipping. The eatery was a great place to sit relax with a coldie and have a meal. It was very fairly priced offering maximum entertainment value...great for families the kids will love it!!!!

title: Highly recommend
text: Wow! First tip: spend the extra money and stay here! You get a complete itinerary of activities including elephant chauffeur for room pick up to bathing and swimming with these (very well looked after) beasts. The up close interaction is breathtaking... you won't be disappointed... I felt completely safe the entire time I was there but beware of floating coconuts in the water!! :-)

title: Elephant Lodge Stay and Park
text: Wow!!! What an amazing experience to get up close and personal with these amazing animals. The elephants looked so happy and content in this purpose built haven..., such great care taken by all the staff and trainers, it was good to see how well they are treated. One of my highlights for Bali 2019. I will be back again to see my favourite baby elephant, so, so cute. Thanks again Mason for providing the experience.

WOW. My friend and I as well as her parents ventured here as part of our vacation to Bali and it was very much worth it! We got to have a 30 minute elephant ride during which we chatted with our elephant's trainer and got some great photos. Our elephant (Arum) was a sweetheart and gave us a great ride. After our ride we got to feed the adult and baby elephants and get more great photos! We were able to pet them and hug them, too, which as an animal lover was my favorite part! There was also a brief 10 minute show where the elephants did a few tricks that was fun to watch. Lunch buffet at the park was good; after we ate the trainers and caretakers let us take more up close photos and give more hugs and pets. The elephants were so sweet and seemed to have great lives in the; ‚Ä¶

title: Elephant bathing, washing
text: Wow... where do I start? Me and my boyfriend stayed in a park view room for 1 night at the end of our stay in Bali and we were amazed from the moment we arrived to the moment we left with how exceptional the experience and staff were. Upon arrival, we were greeted by friendly faces & a welcome drink - our room wasn't quite ready as we did arrive early although there is luggage storage on site so we were able to leave our suitcases and roam the park. The elephants are SO fascinating, they appear happy and well looked after. Yes they are chained up over night because they can be very destructive animals, after watching the elephants get chained/unchained they didn't seem stressed or in any discomfort. This is my opinion from what I saw from our 24+ hours at the park. The; ‚Ä¶

Writing this halfway through our 2 night stay here! From the friendly greeting with cold towels and drinks after a 2 hour drive! We were shown to our room for the next 2 nights No227. Is this a 5 star resort? You bet your life it is! The room is superb! Very very clean, well appointed, comfortable bed, spacious bathroom, definitely 5 star accommodation. The restaurant is where we took our evening meal last night and the A La Carte menu is very reasonable and the food superbly presented and delicious. As guests all the activities are included in your room price! The breakfast is plentiful and very nice indeed. Eating meals whilst watching the gentle giants is amazing! Now the nitty gritty! The elephants themselves! They are very well looked after! The staff love them and care; ‚Ä¶

Yes, very enjoyable experience. Pleasant atmosphere, nice to have the 'transfer' to the restaurant on Elephant back, nice to have breakfast overlooking a field with Elephants, definitely recommend this place. Bear in mind though that Elephants will leave a certain 'aroma' behind, as they collect guests from the hotel rooms - and this smell stays around. We did not mind, you get used to it - and it's more than made up for by the overall experience - but it may put some people off.

title: Peaceful resort & perfect weather!
text: You are really paying for access to the Elephants when you book here and in terms of our overall expectations, the lodge delivered. We had a Park-view room for my husband, myself and master 5 and a garden view room for our 20 and 23 year old. The garden view rooms are good value as you still experience everything that those in a Park-view room do, minus the additional $320.00 USD per night. I booked a Paddy room through Wotif.com for the two older kids with an automatic upgrade, factor in breakfast (buffet and a la carte) and it's a very reasonable deal. I wanted a balcony and view but I'm not sure the extra cost was really worth those features along with the larger room and bathroom (no bath in the Parkview rooms either). You don't actually spend that much time in your room; ‚Ä¶

date-review: Jennifer D wrote a review Jun 2019
title: Sad experience
text: You can only compliment the owner and his dedication to this sanctuary over the past decades. What he has also created to the community is extra ordinary. Whilst the animals cant talk they indicate all signs of happiness and well being. The stars are obviously these big Asian Elephants but the real gems are the people behind. Each one of them from gardener to driver to the elephant care taker are extremely professional, speak great english and truly love their job. Make sure you stay at the rooms overlooking the feeding ponds (#1-4) Such an amazing experience, keep up this special tribute to mother nature

title: Wonderful and excellent vacation!
text: You must come here while you're in Bali! This place is incredible! We were greeted on arrival with a cold towel and a refreshing drink and from there things just got better and better. We were shown to our room, with our bags following shortly afterwards. The room was fantastic. It was spacious, very comfortable, and well appointed. The bed was great, and we had towels made into an elephant waiting for us. Cute. No sooner had we arrived in our room, then there was a knock on our door. An elephant was standing outside waiting to take us to the last elephant show of the evening, and a stunning outdoor buffet. The outdoor restaurant was a very romantic setting, white tablecloths, under illuminated palm trees beside the pool. The food was amazing, a huge variety, lots; ‚Ä¶

You wouldn't think elephants could be romantic but they were at the Elephant Safari Lodge in Ubud, Bali. Thanks to the great conservation work of Nigel Morris it is possible to see these wonderful creatures up close whilst at the same time having a 5 str luxury stay in your own mod con villa.the highlight of the trip is 'booking' yoru own elephant to come and take you to dinner and then after a fantastic meal, plod home through the trees....a must for all romantic couples and families with small kids everywhere...
